summary: This bill, the Social Security Enhancement and Protection Act of 2025, proposes several amendments to the Social Security Act. Key provisions include increasing the special minimum benefit for low-wage earners, establishing increased benefits for long-term beneficiaries, extending child benefits for post-secondary students, and altering the determination of taxable wages and self-employment income above the contribution and benefit base. It also introduces a new bend point in the benefit calculation and increases employment tax rates. Finally, it specifies that benefit increases from this Act will not impact eligibility for means-tested programs.
